items.title: Entire Ukrainian family killed in Russian drone strike, officials say
bullets: • Couple and their two young sons, aged four and six, killed in Russian drone strike
• Bodies of the two children and their parents were later recovered from the wreckage
• Ukraine's air force said its units shot down 46 out of 65 Russian drones overnight

items.title: Former aide to far-right German politician jailed for spying for China
bullets: • Former aide to far-right German politician jailed for spying for China
• Chinese national given four-year jail term for working for Chinese intelligence
• He was also accused of spying on Chinese dissidents and opposition figures in Germany
• Judge: "I did not work for a Chinese intelligence agency"

items.title: Thousands of workers in limbo as US-Africa trade deal set to expire
bullets: • The African Growth and Opportunity Act is set to expire on Tuesday
• It has given some African goods duty-free access to the US market for 25 years
• But it is at odds with the Trump administration's policy of imposing tariffs on African imports

items.title: Afghanistan sees telecom shutdown as Taliban cut off internet
bullets: • Taliban government in Afghanistan has imposed a nationwide shutdown of telecommunications
• The country is currently experiencing a "total internet blackout", internet watchdog Netblocks reports
• Mobile internet and satellite TV have also been severely disrupted across Afghanistan
• Taliban have imposed numerous restrictions in accordance with their interpretation of Islamic Sharia law

items.title: Leaders in Middle East and Europe welcome Trump's Gaza peace plan
bullets: • Leaders in Middle East and Europe welcome US peace plan for Gaza
• President Donald Trump and Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu agree to the plan
• It calls for an immediate end to fighting and release of hostages held by Hamas
• Netanyahu later again again again rules out an eventual Palestinian state

items.title: U.S. Commerce head Lutnick wants Taiwan to help America make 50% of its chips locally
bullets: • U.S
• Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick says Taiwan is said to produce over 90% of the world's advanced semiconductors
• The move could have implications for Taiwan's national defense, he said
• Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co
• is Taiwan's largest and most advanced contract chipmaker, which handles production for American tech heavyweights like Apple

items.title: Here's what a government shutdown could affect around the country
bullets: • Without congressional action, government funding will expire at 12:01 a.m
• on Oct
• The U.S
• Postal Service will keep the mail moving as usual in the event of a shutdown

items.title: Federal workers who took Trump's buyout get final paychecks and an uncertain future
bullets: • Federal workers who took Trump's buyout get final paychecks and an uncertain future
• Stephani Cherkaoui is one of more than 150,000 federal workers taking the "Fork in the Road" buyout offer
• She agreed to share her thoughts and opinions with NPR, emphasizing that she does not speak for the government

items.title: EV sales surge in the U.S. ahead of Sept. 30 tax credit deadline
bullets: • EV sales surge in the U.S
• ahead of the Sept
• 30 tax credit deadline
• The Republican tax and spending package that passed in early July brought an early end to federal EV tax credits
• The credits end on September 30

items.title: As sports betting explodes, should states set more limits to stop gambling addiction?
bullets: • Massachusetts is promoting its "GameSense" program to curb problem gambling
• The state's first casino opened in 2015, and as the gaming industry grew, the state developed what it calls a "responsible gaming" program
• Outside the casinos, GameSense is marketed on social media and on sportsbook apps and websites

items.title: With no guarantee of U.S. weapons, Ukraine races to make its own
bullets: • With no guarantee of U.S
• weapons, Ukraine races to make its own drones
• Many Ukrainian drones cost $1,000 or less and are only used once
• Ukraine's arsenal consisted largely of aging hardware dating back decades to when Russia and Ukraine were part of the Soviet Union

items.title: Government to shut down after midnight barring last minute breakthrough in Congress
bullets: • Government to shut down after midnight barring last minute breakthrough in Congress
• Lawmakers have less than 24 hours to reach a deal before a midnight deadline
• Senate Democrats have refused to back the spending bill in an effort to force Republicans to negotiate on federal health care subsidies
• They are pushing for an extension of Affordable Care Act subsidies that are set to expire at the end of the year in exchange for their support

items.title: ‘I think we’re headed to a shutdown,’ says JD Vance as Mike Johnson calls for more time for negotiations – as it happened
bullets: • House Speaker wants more time for negotiations on a deal to avoid a government shutdown
• President Donald Trump and Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu hold talks on a proposed Gaza peace plan
• US President Barack Obama has proposed a 20-point deal with Israel, but no deal is reached

items.title: US justice department sues Minnesota over sanctuary city policies
bullets: • Minnesota is latest state to be sued over sanctuary city immigration policies
• It is the latest jurisdiction to face legal threats from the Trump administration
• Minnesota cities of Minneapolis, St Paul and Hennepin county join the ranks of Los Angeles, New York, Boston, and New Jersey and Colorado

items.title: Trump news at a glance: UK and French leaders back president’s peace plan for Gaza
bullets: • Donald Trump and Benjamin Netanyahu deliver ultimatum to Hamas to accept peace plan or face consequences
• UK PM Keir Starmer calls on Hamas to ‘agree to the plan and end the misery’ French president Emmanuel Macron says “France stands ready to contribute” to efforts to end the war

items.title: Namibia deploys army to fight wildfire burning third of Etosha game reserve
bullets: • Namibia has begun deploying hundreds of soldiers to fight a fire that has burned through a third of Etosha national park
• The park in the north of the largely desert country is home to 114 species of mammals, notably the critically endangered black rhinoceros
• The fire had been burning since 22 September and had caused extensive ecological damage

items.title: The endangered cactus behind Mexico's sweet secret
bullets: • Barches of barrel cactus have been chopped up and seeped in vats of sugar until they're crystalized
• The Mexican government began banning the sale of acitrón in the early 2000s
• The biznaga cactus was found to be in danger of extinction due to overexploitation

items.title: Meet the woman steering Biden's bipartisan winning streak on Capitol Hill
bullets: • The White House has a long list of issues facing the nation's first two years of Congress
• President Barack Obama and his staff are working on a bipartisan agenda
• They say it's important to keep the public eye on what's happening in the U.S

items.title: NoViolet Bulawayo wins the Best of Caine award
bullets: • Best of Caine Prize for African Writing is awarded for a short story
• The story examines the lives of a group of children in Budapest, Hungary
• The winner of the award will be announced at the end of the month
• The award was handed out at the British Library in London today

items.title: Tropical Storm Imelda expected to batter parts of the southeastern U.S. this week
bullets: • Parts of the U.S
• are expected to be hit by Tropical Storm I-Bahamas
• The storm is expected to bring heavy rain to parts of the country
• Parts of South Carolina, Florida and Georgia are in the path of the storm
• The hurricane is a tropical depression

items.title: Is taking acetaminophen during pregnancy really associated with autism in children?
bullets: • President Trump suggested that taking acetaminophen during pregnancy is linked to autism in children
• Doctors disagree and say there's no strong evidence for that
• Tylenol could play a role in ongoing legal cases against the company that makes it
• NPR's pharmaceuticals correspondent, Sydney Lupkin, joins us in the comments

items.title: Meteorite collectors gather in Cincinnati this weekend for 'Meet a Meteorite'
bullets: • Meteorite collectors gather in Cincinnati this weekend for 'Meet a Meteorite' The rocks that hurtle from outer space and make it to Earth get a moment to shine
• At the Cincinnati Observatory later today, collectors will be showing off some of their treasures

items.title: How Kyrsten Sinema's decision makes Democrats' 2024 Senate map tighter
bullets: • Arizona Sen
• Kyrsten Sinema has always been a thorn in the Democrats side during her time in Congress
• She voted against her party more than almost any other member of Congress
• Now, the Democratic caucus has 48 Democrats and three independents

items.title: Startup founder Charlie Javice sentenced to 7 years in prison for defrauding JPMorgan Chase
bullets: • Charlie Javice is sentenced to 85 months in prison
• He was found guilty of defrauding JPMorgan Chase by overstating how many customers it had
• Javice, 33, cried as she delivered an emotional statement to the court
• "I will spend my entire life regretting these errors," she said

items.title: This tiny butterfly has the most chromosomes of any animal on Earth
bullets: • This tiny butterfly has the most chromosomes of any animal on Earth
• Unlike duplication, its chromosomes split apart, reshaping its genome in surprising ways
• Discovery sheds light on evolution, conservation, and even cancer research
• The Atlas blue butterfly is increasingly threatened by climate change and human impact

items.title: Jim Cramer explains why he thinks the AI boom is different than the dotcom bubble
bullets: • CNBC's Jim Cramer pushed back against the narrative that Wall Street's fervor for artificial intelligence is the same as the dotcom bubble of 2000
• He said there are major differences in terms of the quality and funding of the current Big Tech stocks that are leading the market to new heights

items.title: Trump obtains another settlement as YouTube agrees to pay $24.5 million
bullets: • Google owner Alphabet agrees to pay $24.5 million to settle lawsuit filed by President Trump in 2021
• Trump sued YouTube over his account being suspended after January 6, 2021, attack on US Capitol
• Trump directed $22 million to be contributed to the Trust for the National Mall, a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt entity, to support the construction of the White House State Ballroom

items.title: Another setback for Firefly Aerospace’s beleaguered rocket program
bullets: • The booster stage for Firefly Aerospace's next Alpha rocket was destroyed Monday in a fiery accident on the company's test stand in Texas
• Engineers were testing the rocket before shipment to Vandenberg Space Force Base, California, to prepare for launch later this year
• The rocket was undergoing test-firings of the booster's four kerosene-fueled engines

items.title: YouTube agrees to pay Trump $24.5 Million to settle lawsuit over suspended account
bullets: • YouTube has agreed to pay $24.5 million to settle a lawsuit involving the suspension of President Donald Trump's account
• The settlement "shall not constitute an admission of liability or fault," a court filing says
• Trump sued YouTube, Facebook and Twitter in mid-2021, after the companies suspended his accounts

items.title: Trump talks with Democrats fail to yield breakthrough as US shutdown nears
bullets: • Democrats are refusing to support GOP legislation to keep government open beyond Tuesday unless it includes several healthcare provisions
• Republican leaders of the Senate and House of Representatives also met in the Oval Office on Monday
• But there was little sign that Republicans had shifted from their demands that Senate Democrats vote for their bill that would keep the government open

items.title: Anthropic says its new AI model “maintained focus” for 30 hours on multistep tasks
bullets: • Anthropic releases Claude Sonnet 4.5, a new AI language model
• Anthropic calls it its "most capable model to date" with improved coding and computer use capabilities
• The company also released Claude Code 2.0, a command-line AI agent for developers, and the Claude Agent SDK

items.title: Sports piracy site Streameast returns after US government let domain expire
bullets: • Homeland Security Investigations (HSI) seized several domains belonging to the Streameast piracy network in August 2024
• After the seizure, trying to access those sites resulted in a pop-up from HSI stating, ‘THIS DOMAIN HAS BEEN SEIZED.”

items.title: 'We're headed to a shutdown,' Vance says after Trump meeting with leaders ends
bullets: • Vice President JD Vance: "I think we're headed to a shutdown because the Democrats won't do the right thing" Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer and House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries met with President Donald Trump at the White House on Monday
• The meeting comes less than two days before the government will begin in the absence of a funding deal

items.title: Des Moines revokes education license of school superintendent arrested by Ice
bullets: • Ian Roberts, the superintendent of Iowa’s largest school district, was arrested last week by US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (Ice) agents
• He was found in possession of a loaded handgun and the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives is investigating how he obtained it

items.title: EA will be a very different company under private ownership
bullets: • Electronic Arts plans to sell itself to a consortium of private equity firms
• The $55 billion deal is the largest leveraged buyout in history
• The new owners will be saddled with roughly $20 billion of new debt
• The company will be on the hook for roughly $1 billion a year in service payments on that debt

items.title: Astronomers stunned as fiery auroras blaze on a planet without a star
bullets: • Astronomers stunned as fiery auroras blaze on a planet without a star
• The James Webb Telescope has revealed fierce auroras, storms, and unchanging sand-like clouds
• These insights are pushing the boundaries of our understanding of alien atmospheres and exoplanet weather

items.title: Madagascar’s president dissolves government amid youth-led protests
bullets: • President Andry Rajoelina has dissolved the government after youth-led protests over water and power cuts
• The UN says 22 people have been killed and more than 100 injured in three days of demonstrations
• Thousands of people have marched in the capital Antananarivo since demonstrations began last week

items.title: Wildfire in Namibia is contained, says PM, after criticism of response
bullets: • The fire broke out in Etosha national park, in Namibia's north, on 22 September
• The government said it suspected charcoal production next to the park was to blame
• It said 49 soldiers were being deployed to fight the fires and a further 500 on Sunday

items.title: West Africans deported from US to Ghana ‘dumped without documents in Togo’
bullets: • Eight to 10 west African nationals have been forcibly sent by Ghana to Togo, bypassing a formal border crossing, and then left on the street without passports
• Up to 28 people have arrived in the west African nation from the US so far in the deportation programme

items.title: Scared of spiders? Some former arachnophobes now are keeping jumping spiders as pets
bullets: • Thousands of jumping spiders are being flooded with requests from people who want to keep them as pets
• Social media videos of the spiders' antics have been viewed millions of times on YouTube
• Some women are trying to overcome their fear of spiders, while others are simply enchanted by their unexpected cuteness

items.title: Hubble finds a hybrid galaxy with a mysterious and violent past
bullets: • Hubble finds a hybrid galaxy with a mysterious and violent past
• NGC 2775 lies 67 million light-years away in the constellation Cancer (The Crab) Blending features of spirals, ellipticals, and lenticulars, its structure may be the result of past galactic mergers

items.title: Earth was born dry until a cosmic collision made it a blue planet
bullets: • Earth was born dry until a cosmic collision made it a blue planet
• Initially, the planet was barren and inhospitable, missing water and carbon compounds
• A colossal collision with Theia likely changed everything, bringing the essential ingredients for life
• Study highlights that habitability may hinge on rare chance events

items.title: Black hole discovery confirms Einstein and Hawking were right
bullets: • New observations of a merger of two black holes confirm decades-old predictions by Albert Einstein, Stephen Hawking and Roy Kerr
• Scientists tracked the complete cosmic collision, confirming that black holes are defined by mass and spin
• They also gained stronger proof that a black hole’s event horizon only grows, echoing thermodynamic laws

items.title: Opera launches its AI browser, but you’ll have to pay to try it
bullets: • Opera has rolled out its AI browser, Neon, to some users for $19.90 per month
• The Norwegian software company first announced the “agentic browser” in May
• Neon includes different AI agents that are tailored to specific tasks
• The rollout is limited to an unspecified number of users

items.title: Logitech’s MX Master 4 adds haptic feedback, mostly just for fun
bullets: • Logitech’s MX Master 4 wireless mouse adds haptic feedback to everyday tasks
• The haptics are a hardware feature that, unsurprisingly, requires you to engage pretty heavily with Logi Options Plus
• The Haptic Sense Panel embedded in its grippy thumb rest vibrates when pressed, opening Logitech's Action Ring overlay

items.title: Here are 55 great deals you can snag ahead of Amazon’s fall Prime Day event
bullets: • Amazon announced that its fall Prime Day sale will kick off on Tuesday, October 7th, and run through October 8th
• Amazon has already started dropping early deals and discounts on a range of gadgets, from wireless earbuds to charging stations
• You can even get three months of Kindle Unlimited for free

items.title: YouTube caves to Trump with $24.5 million settlement
bullets: • YouTube has settled a lawsuit President Donald Trump filed against the company in 2021
• Trump filed sweeping lawsuits against Google-owned YouTube, Meta (then Facebook), and X (then Twitter) after he was suspended from the platforms
• YouTube, like Meta and X, is paying to end Trump’s lawsuit over content moderation decisions following the January 6th insurrection at the Capitol

items.title: SB 53, the landmark AI transparency bill, is now law in California
bullets: • Senate Bill 53, the landmark AI transparency bill, is now law in California
• It establishes safety reporting requirements for large AI companies
• It's the second draft of such a bill, as Gov
• Gavin Newsom vetoed the first version last year

items.title: CNN Political Briefing
bullets: • CNN Political Director David Chalian takes you inside the latest developments with insight and analysis from the key players in politics
• Suzan DelBene (D-WA) is laser-focused on re-capturing the House in 2026
• The race for New Jersey governor could be the sleeper contest of the year

items.title: The Axe Files with David Axelrod
bullets: • The Axe Files with David Axelrod is a series of revealing interviews with key figures in the political world
• This week marks the final episode of the series of interviews with Axelrod's friend, US Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel
• Scott Jennings is well known as a conservative firebrand on CNN
